The Bukusu-English dictionary is an app to lookup English definitnions of Bukusu words. It is intended to serve as an aid to language learners who know English but seek knowlege of the Bukusu language
The Lubukusu-English dictionary app is based on the draft of the "Bukusu-English Dictionary" compiled and edited by Michael Marlo, Adrian Sifuna, Aggrey Wasike (2008).
"The app allows the user to search for a word on the top tab or to lookup a word on the alphabetically ordered list of all the words."

"The dictionary retains all the tone marking of the original source but also includes the spelling of words as commonly spelled/used.
In the present transcription system, long vowels are marked as a sequence of two vowels, e.g.,[aa]. A syllable boundary between two vowels is marked by '.'. High-tone is marked with an acute accent. Low-tone is unmarked, 'b' represents [b] after a nasal and [β] elsewhere, 'ch' represents [č], 'sh' represents [š], 'kh' represents [x], 'ng'' ('ng' followed by an apostrophe) represents [ŋ], 'nj' represents [ñǰ], and 'ng' represents [ŋg].
In general, 'ny' should represent the palatal nasal [ñ], although there may be cases where the same orthographic sequence represents the sequence of a coronal nasal followed by a palatal glide, i.e., [ny]."

"The following abbreviations are used to mark parts of speech: 'adj' - adjective 'adv' - adverb 'comp' - complement 'conj' - conjunction 'dem' - demonstrative 'excl' - exclamation 'ideo' - ideophone 'loc' - locative 'n' - noun 'neg' - negation element 'np' - noun phrase 'num' - numeral 'poss' - possessive pronoun 'pp' - prepositional phrase 'prep' - preposition 'pron' - pronoun 'quan' - quantifier 'relcl' - relative clause 's' - sentence 'v' - verb 'vint' - intransitive verb 'vrefl' - reflexivized verb 'vpass' - passivized verb 'vtr' - transitive verb 'vp' - verb phrase 'wh' - wh- (question) element"
"On the settings menu the user is able to adjust the app theme between the normal mode (light) and the dark mode as per their preference."
"The team responsible for developing this app is constantly looking for collaborators and contributors to help make the dictionary better."
